message.body: 0wiki is already a thing: http://127.0.0.1:43110/0wiki.bit/ . Not perfect, but it works. It's also cloneable so you can make your own if you'd like. Unless you meant with all of Wikipedia's content. In which case you might have a difficult time figuring out how to port the articles from the downloaded copy to zeronet without requiring people to DL many GB.

@styromaniac - The closest we've got to a function youtube-like site is stuff built on webtorrent. ZeroTube is honestly shit since you can't actually go to the video page. But KopyKate works fine if you can seed. If you're looking for a non-webtorrent solution, I think your best bet would be the ZeroMux stuff ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1LxkfGxtWhktAJ5WJ9ZnKxksTSH37qm8cC/1481692571 ) or ipfs ( https://ipfs.io/ )
